oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A concise protecting-group-free synthesis of cephalosporolides E and F
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: CHAUDHARI, DA
KATTANGURU, P
FERNANDES, RA
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MARINE-DERIVED FUNGUS
PENICILLIUM-SP
LACTONES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A concise protecting-group-free synthesis of cephalosporolides E and F has been described. The key steps involve the one-pot conversion of L-mannonic-gamma-lactone to gamma-vinyl-beta-hydroxy-gamma-lactone, cross-metathesis and Wacker-type oxidative spiroketalization. The internal olefin served as a latent keto functionality with excellent delivery of a regioselective keto group for spiroketalization. The synthetic strategy is protecting-group-free and marks the shortest route so far to cephalosporolides E and F.
